intro: Coleogeton filiformis subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western threadleaf, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant features slender, thread-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing pale yellow to greenish blooms. This subspecies is adapted to arid conditions and has a low-growing habit to conserve moisture.
